isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Installation - Main Bearing Fit Procedure

figure.caption: Main bearing cap and lower main bearing

note.para: Main bearing caps and the back of main bearing surfaces must be free of oil and dirt. Do not lubricate the backside of main bearings.

step1.para: Install lower main bearing in each main bearing cap. Make sure bearing alignment tabs snap in each bearing cap notch.

figure.caption: Main bearing cap and crankcase stamps

calloutgroup.callout1: Main bearing cap stamp on #7 main bearing cap
M15 x 162 main bearing cap bolt (14)

step1.para: Orient each main bearing cap with its matching crankcase stamp.
Clean each lower main bearing surface and the exposed half of the crankshaft journal. These surfaces must be free of oil.
Install each main bearing cap assembly. Lightly oil threads of new main bearing bolts with clean engine oil.

note.para: Bearing clearance measurement checks bearing fit and will not permanently stretch main bearing bolts. Do not torque-to-yield main bearing bolts until final assembly.

figure.caption: Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence

step1.para: Tighten each main bearing cap bolt to 136 N·m (100 lbf·ft) using "Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence".
Tighten each main bearing bolt to 177 N·m (130 lbf·ft) using "Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence".
Remove one main bearing cap assembly at a time. Leave other caps tight.
Wipe oil from all contact surfaces of the exposed crankshaft journal and main bearing.

note.para:
For in chassis service only: the crankshaft must be supported and held against the upper main bearing halves to get a correct Plastigage®
reading. Use a jack to support the crankshaft at the counterweight nearest each main bearing being checked. Failure to support the crankshaft will result in inaccurate readings.

step1.para: Place a piece of Plastigage® across the full width of the bearing surface on the crankshaft journal (or bearing insert) approximately 6 mm (0.25 in) off center. Install the bearing cap and tighten main bearing cap bolts to 177 N·m (130 lbf·ft).
Remove main bearing cap assembly. Do not disturb the Plastigage®.

Measure Plastigage® using the scale on the Plastigage® envelope. Measure the widest point of the flattened Plastigage®. This reading indicates the bearing clearance in thousandths of an inch or millimeters.
Remove Plastigage®, install main bearing cap assembly, and tighten main bearing bolts to 177 N·m (130 lbf·ft). Repeat steps 7 through 11 for all seven main bearings.
If main bearing to crankshaft running clearances are not within Specifications , replace the crankshaft or resurface the crankshaft and install oversize main bearings.
